pullRequest.title: [automation] Added ItemStateUpdate action
pullRequest.bodyText:
Added ItemStateUpdate action

Closes #1926
Signed-off-by: Christoph Weitkamp github@christophweitkamp.de

commit.message:
Added ItemUpdate action

Signed-off-by: Christoph Weitkamp <github@christophweitkamp.de>

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * This is an implementation of an ActionHandler. It send state updates for items.
          
          
            
             * This is an implementation of an ActionHandler. It sends state updates for items.

We have ItemStateEvents for this and we generally refer to ItemStateUpdates in order to distinguish them from ItemUpdates (i.e. changes to the item itself). I'd hence prefer to also keep it here this way and name this core.ItemStateUpdateAction.

The ItemCommandActionHandler does this check only within execute, but not within the constructor. I think that's the much better approach, because the item might not be defined at rule definition time, while this should not cause the rule to not initialize.
The item should not be cached here as it can potentially change over time. Get the latest item in execute instead.

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            			"label": "update state",
          
          
            
            			"label": "update an item state",

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            					"description": "state that will be used to update the item."
          
          
            
            					"description": "state that the item will be set to."

+			"configDescriptions": [

+					"name": "itemName",

+					"name": "state",
+					"type": "TEXT",
+					"label": "State",
+					"description": "the default state to be used to update the item if none is passed as an input value",
+					"required": true,
+					"limitToOptions": false,
+					"options": [
+						{
+							"label": "ON",
+							"value": "ON"
+						},

+							"value": "UP"
+						},
+						{
+							"label": "DOWN",
+							"value": "DOWN"
+						}
+					]
+				}
+			],
+			"inputs": [
+				{
+					"name": "state",
+					"type": "state",
+					"label": "State",
+					"description": "state that will be used to update the item."

commit.message:
Incorporated comments from review

Signed-off-by: Christoph Weitkamp <github@christophweitkamp.de>

nodes.bodyText: Looking closer into the code, I am not 100% certain that the module configuration cannot be changed during the lifetime of the handler. I at least found ConfigurationNormalizer.normalizeConfiguration, which reads the configuration object and modifies it. I'd hence feel safer if this would be re-read in execute, just as it is done for the ItemCommandActionHandler.
